posts.name: Kirby Caldwell
posts.cooked: Our team uses command based java script and this season one driver wants to control our mecanum drive train and the other control our arm and shooting capabilities. I was thinking of establishing two different controllers (a ps4 and an xbox controller) so that the button bindings do not conflict. I was wondering if there is an easier way to establish this in my code and maybe use 2 xbox controllers.

posts.name: Jeremy Reed
posts.cooked: It sounds like you have the right idea, we do this in our code and one is used for our drive command and the other for our operator actions.

posts.name: Pat Mattin
posts.cooked:
WPILib documentation.

When setting up multiple controllers, you declare each separately. There are no button conflicts, they’re differentiated by the USB port used in the driver station.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked:
pmattin5459:

differentiated by the USB port used in the driver station.

Small nitpick, but they’re differentiated by dragging them around in driverstation

posts.name: Zach
posts.cooked: i have a similar question but don’t think it deserves its own thread. is there a limit on how many devices (ex. controllers) you can use to control a bot? i’ve only ever remembered seeing 2, never more than that

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: The Driver Station has 6 joystick slots.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: If you write a program to send the joystick input over networktables and use that, your limit is the about 10 that windows does well with
